title: If you could choose 3-4 musicians to form a band, who would they be, what type of music would they play, and why would you choose them? - Quora

response.answer_text: James Hetfield - Lead Guitar, purely because of his solo in “To Live Is To Die” by Metallica. Zakk Wylde - Vocals, rhythm guitar purely because of his voice on Black Label Society Live +5. Brann Dailor - Drums, because of “Call Of The Mastodon” and a few other albums. Cliff Burton - Bass Guitar. No need for explanation. They are a Metal band that play with melody, because of Hetfield’s playing, they have heavy low - tuned riffs, and brutal vocals because of Zakk Wylde (Alcohol Fuelled Brewtality voice), who also can sing any style. They have a phenomenal drummer, that does what’s needed, and one of the best bassists ever.

If I bring people back from the dead Terry Kath - Guitar, vocals Jack Holden- Bass ( a phenomenal player nobody has ever heard of. Jaco Pastorius school player) Joe Morello - Drums Reese Wynans - Keyboards. I’d add a horn section on occasion. Lee Thornburg -Trumpet, Richard “Slide” Hyde-Trombone, Steve Douglas- Saxophone I’d like to hear how Terry Kath would interact with a 2nd guitar player. So maybe I’d add the best 2nd guitarist to ever play in a band, Dickie Betts- Guitar. Dickie could definitely handle the jazz influences everyone else brings. They’d play Soulful Rock and Blues with a Jazz style.
